posts.post_content: You guys are all missing the point. This card is from Ravnica, where the entire plane is one giant city with no untouched natural spots left. Thus all the lands, basic and nonbasic, are depicted as urban structures associated with their color. Look at [Overgrown Tomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overgrown Tomb) - a tomb is not a swamp, but it unmistakably conveys black.

posts.post_content:
As has been said, deserts are perfect examples of a blending of Mountains and Plains. They are essentially plains made of pieces of rock/ mineral, and there is little transition between rugged spire and white waste in the desert. Also, they are plains...that are hot.  
  
That said, the pictured land is far from a desert.

posts.post_content: I don't see Plains and Mountains as opposites.. There are many desert areas with plenty of mountainous terrain, usually accompanied by a large amount of plainsland. One example is Kah-Nee-Ta in Oregon.

posts.post_content: So these cards are awesome because no matter what you can have them come into play tapped, and with fetches, well boy howdy you can fetch em annnd the come into play tapped. Which is awesome, except to fetch and untap thats three life, which usually isn't a problem. However, I was watching some games where it would be like zoo versus zoo, and these guys would shoot themselves down to like 14 or 11 just fetching these lands. I understand life is not the most valuable resource, but it is still important and should be considered. Just play a couple basics.
